title: How to Draw a Detailed Ice Cream Cone

steps.headline: Add two slanted lines overlapping each other on top of the V shape.
steps.description: Cover the cone with a convex line.

steps.headline: Draw two more slanted lines on top mimicking the first two you have drawn earlier.
steps.description: sketch criss-crossed slanted lines on the rest of the cone.

steps.headline: Outline the side of the cone making curves where the criss-crossed lines meet.
Darken outline on the mouth of the cone.
Draw small squares inside each compartment from the criss-crossed lines.
First with your pencil, start off by drawing the ice cream scoop itself.
steps.description: Draw it as if you were going to draw a half circle.

steps.headline: Next, draw the bottom portion of your ice cream scoop.
steps.description: The scoop's base should have a ruffled appearance almost.

steps.headline: Continue drawing in more detail to your scoop's base like so.
With the details added, your scoop is starting to take form and look a bit more realistic than in the first step.
A real life ice cream scoop is not perfectly round like you see in cartoony ones.
steps.description: There are tons of lines and indentations in the scoop itself.

steps.headline: Now, we are ready to move on to the cone portion.
steps.description: Draw your cone like a narrow, upside down triangle.

steps.headline: Think about the overall design of an ice cream cone.
steps.description: It's crisscrossed like a waffle. Start drawing in your crisscross pattern in this step.

steps.headline: After you are finished with your crisscross design, that is all for the drawing process!
Feel free to color your ice cream cone using an art medium of your choice.
steps.description: Get creative with it if you want! That's a wrap!

text: Ice Cream Cone without Scoop Draw a V shape.  Add two slanted lines overlapping each other on top of the V shape. Cover the cone with a convex line. Draw two more slanted lines on top mimicking the first two you have drawn earlier. sketch criss-crossed slanted lines on the rest of the cone. Outline the side of the cone making curves where the criss-crossed lines meet.  Darken outline on the mouth of the cone.  Draw small squares inside each compartment from the criss-crossed lines.  Erase unnecessary lines.  Color your drawing.  Ice Cream Cone with Scoop First with your pencil, start off by drawing the ice cream scoop itself. Draw it as if you were going to draw a half circle. Next, draw the bottom portion of your ice cream scoop. The scoop's base should have a ruffled appearance almost. Continue drawing in more detail to your scoop's base like so.  With the details added, your scoop is starting to take form and look a bit more realistic than in the first step.  A real life ice cream scoop is not perfectly round like you see in cartoony ones. There are tons of lines and indentations in the scoop itself. Now, we are ready to move on to the cone portion. Draw your cone like a narrow, upside down triangle. Think about the overall design of an ice cream cone. It's crisscrossed like a waffle. Start drawing in your crisscross pattern in this step. After you are finished with your crisscross design, that is all for the drawing process!  Feel free to color your ice cream cone using an art medium of your choice. Get creative with it if you want! That's a wrap! Finished.
